title.narrative: Emergency Resilient Recovery Project For The Northern And Central Mozambique

description.narrative:
The final objective of the consultancy is to support the Government of Mozambique in reducing the vulnerability to natural disasters and increase the level of protection for of all children in schools that are periodically affected by disasters in Zambézia, Nampula and Niassa provinces, through the implementation of improved reconstruction of school buildings, which were drastically affected and damaged by the strong winds and floods during the cyclone and rainy season 2014-2015.
The specific objective is to provide technical support to rehabilitate 433 conventional material classrooms and to rebuild 1438 classrooms in an improved and safer way through the preparation, elaboration, adoption and implementation of building school models of different typologies and building materials adapted to natural hazards.
The global outcome of the consultancy will lay on making schools and communities more resilient to natural hazards and contributing to build safer educational environment, on the bases of capacity development, appropriation ofknowledge and adoption oftechnical measures of improved reconstruction by the participants in the Provinces of Zambézia, Nampula and Niassa. It is expected to capitalize on the benefits of this reconstruction initiative - the first large-scale effort to be undertaken in the country - to lay the foundations for future post-disaster recovery strategies and actions in Mozambique.
The proposed technical approach involves various areas, including: institutional development and capacities at central and province level on management and programme planning, transference of technical capacities on building-back-better reconstruction to the Govt. Technicians, NGOs and contractors and the inclusion of a driven community process in the field as well as the adoption of good practices and lessons leamed from international experiences in post-disaster areas. The process will be under the general coordination of the Ministry of Education and Human Development (MINEDH-DIEE) and, in accordance with the provided Terms of References, UN-Habitat will assist in four (4) main tasks, as following:
(l) Organizational, Institutional and Programme planning, (2) providing technical support on building-back-better school projects and development of the procurement documentation for hiring third implementing partners (3) capacity building at central and province level and (4) field monitoring and supervision through the implementation of a community based approach at local level.
To achieve expected results, the implementing methodology proposes six (6) Working Packages phased and interconnected with each other and in alignment with the payment phasing, during the 30 month of implementation. Each Working Package has been organized to include the four (4) technical tasks above mentioned, which were agreed with the WNEDH.
